ContentArr.Question: How do you get to school every day?

Options.Feedback: This is a great sustainable practice to get to school!
If you are absolutely insistent on driving, then consider carpooling with your friends!
This is a great way to travel more sustainably to campus!
Wow, you must live very far away from campus. Have you considered on-campus housing?

ContentArr.Question: How often do you eat meat / animal products?

Options.Feedback: You are AWESOME! Good job on reducing your ecological footprint!
This is a good amount of meat to consume. If you want to reduce your meat consumption even more, you can find protein in different sources!
Producing meat is very impactful on your ecological footprint, since it produces a lot of greenhouse gases. If possible, reduce your meat consumption!

ContentArr.Question: How do you drink your beverages?

Options.Feedback: You should try using a reuseable water bottle! If you are absolutely insistant on using plastic bottles, then try using CSUSM's hydration stations!
This is a great step to being more sustainable with your liquid consumption!
Well, that's an issue then. We highly encourage you to see a doctor.
Great! This is an excellent sustainable practice. Make sure you recycle correctly though!

Well, if you don't want to burn to death due to climate change, you best knock off that attitude! On CSUSM, the staff make it very easy to recycle. If there is a missing trash can, you can contact the sustainability manager!

Options.Selector: I don't have a recycle bin
Options.Feedback: Then recycle on CSUSM! The Sustainability team takes great pride in making sure everything is recycled properly. If you cannot find a trash can or recycle bin, just contact the sustainability manager!

ContentArr.Question: How often do you buy new clothing?

Options.Feedback: Great! Buying clothes only when you need them is a great sustainable practice.
You should consider buying clothes only if you need them. This will also help you save money! Might as well knock out two birds with one stone!

You must either get into a lot of fights, love rolling around in mud, or want to be hip in fashion. We recommend that you buy clothes only when you need them. Not only will you help the planet, but think about the money you'll save!

ContentArr.Question: Did you remember to turn off your lights before going to class?

Options.Feedback: Good job. Not only are you saving on your electrical bill, but you're also being sustainable!
Well, it's certainly not our energy bill that is being used up, but it is our planet! Try to remember next time and be more sustainable!

ContentArr.Question: Do you use LED light bulbs?

Options.Feedback: This is a great sustainable choice for both your wallet and the planet!
If possible, install LED light bulbs! This will help your wallet and the environment!
Try to convince your landlord or boss to switch to LED light bulbs! You will not only save money, but you will also impact our environment in a positive way!
This is a great sustainable practice to not only reduce your power usage, but it will also bring your energy bill down!
We understand it can be expensive, but think about the long term: you'll probably save more money by spending less on your energy bill!
Try to find out by doing some research. If you are not in a position to install solar power, then try convincing a landlord or your boss to install solar panels!

ContentArr.Question: How long do you take showers?

Options.Feedback: This is a great way to be sustainable! Just make sure you are doing a good job washing yourself!
This is a good start. Try taking shorter showers on specific days.
Unless you have a lot of hair to wash, you should try showering less. Not only is it a waste of water in Southern California drought, but it costs a lot of money on your water bill!

Options.Selector: I go to the farmer's market
Options.Feedback: This is a good way to be sustainable! Fresh, healthy produce for your stomach, and a happy environment!
Make sure to double check the stickers on the produce. If possible, buy local produce!
This is an excellent way to be sustainable.
